questions.question: In 1969, the first steps on another world were televised from this iconic location. Which site serves as the launch hub for human space exploration, known for historic Apollo missions?
questions.context: Located on Merritt Island, it has been NASA's primary launch center for human spaceflight since opening in 1968.

questions.question: In 1815, this battlefield was the site where Napoleon Bonaparte faced his final defeat. Which site near Brussels signifies the end of the Napoleonic Wars?
questions.context: This location saw the coalition forces led by the Duke of Wellington overcome Napoleon's army, marking a pivotal point in European history.

questions.question: Opening in 1977, this museum holds the largest collection of prehistoric European art. Which modern architectural museum sits atop Sydney Harbour, dedicated to human and natural history?
questions.context: Adjacent to Hyde Park, it has been a landmark of cultural and scientific research since its establishment.

questions.question: This ancient city was buried under volcanic ash in 79 AD, preserving its frescoes and buildings. Which archaeological site showcases daily Roman life before the eruption?
questions.context: Located near modern Naples, its ruins offer insights into advanced Roman urban planning and society of its time.

questions.question: Swinging open to the public in 1889, this tower initially faced criticism but now symbolizes its city and country. Which wrought-iron lattice tower greets over 7 million visitors annually?
questions.context: Constructed as the entrance arch to the 1889 World's Fair, it has become the most-visited paid monument in the world.
